as i started writing this volume i came
to recall what an old-fashioned chinese
man said about the white people
when asked if the white people were
civilized he made this categorical
statement
civilized far from it you can't civilize
these foreign devils
they are beyond redemption they live
weeks and months without touching a
mouthful of rice
but they eat the flesh of bullocks and
sheep in enormous quantities
nor do they eat meat cooked in small
pieces it is carried into the dining
room in huge chunks often half roar
they cut and slash and tear it apart and
they eat with knives and prongs
it makes a civilized being quite nervous
they even sit down with women around the
table
and the women are served first reversing
the order of nature
i could have written about the american
people in a similar vein in the first or
second week after my arrival in america
but now i cannot write in such a
superficial manner having spent a
quarter of a century as a lecturer in
various parts of the united states
i not only have observed but have
actually lived american life
at this critical hour in world history
when the earth is reverberating with all
sorts of false propaganda against
america
i felt it my duty as well as my
privilege to write a new volume
based on my more mature observation of
american life and culture
few asiatic authors have written about
america for their own people
who form nearly two-thirds of all human
beings
although i have not written this volume
exclusively for them i hope that it will
be read by many of my fellow asiatics
whose primary source of information
about america is the hostile
communist propaganda but will also help
my american friends
to gain a better understanding of their
own rich enviable heritage

by and large a typical american is a
hard-working person
with boundless enthusiasm for work
he rises early in the morning often

he rushes to shave and dress but is

he finally reaches his office just about
